Leaves: Opposite, undivided, egg-shaped to oval, narrowing at the apex, up to 10 cm long, sharply toothed, with 3 cm stalks.
Flowers: Dark blue, purple, or violet, tubular with five lobes, ca. 5 mm across, on long, thin, curved spikes to 45 cm long above the mass of leaves.
FruitSeeds: 3-6 mm long, dark brown to blackish, splitting into two one-seeded fragments.
Habitat: Forests, bushland, roadsides, disturbed areas, along streams, in gardens, and in plantations and pastures.
DistinguishingFeatures: Flowers tend to be darker than in *Stachytarpheta jamaicensis*, and the flower stem is thinner at 1-3 mm, versus 3-5 mm.
